instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
Finally getting around to triaging some of the boards I have laying around that won't power up.

I have a 820-00164 board that shows the green to orange on magsafe charger. Not really sure where to start with no power issues. I have the boardview up.

PP3V42_G3H - 3.41
PPBUS_G3H - 8.57
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.32
PP5V_S5 - 5v
R7080 - 16.30 V

Any insight on what to check next would be great. FYI this board saw liquid damage according to the previous owner. Would love to get it working since it's a 2.2 i7 8gb ram. Overall board looks clean.


Thanks

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
Post PM_SLP_SUS_L, 3V3_SUS, PM_RSMRST_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Well I got the board to power up. PM_SLP_S4_L was 0v which led me to u6100. For whatever reason two resistors near u6100 were missing. All traces are good. Now the issue I'm having is no video. No chime.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE?
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors.
Also check U1950 and U6101 for corrosion.
Do you get 3V at U1950, pins 7 & 3?

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
Yes to vcore.
PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.8V

Yes 3.4v on pin 7 & 3

No corrosion on u1950 and u6101

All spi resistors good

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Additionally I did try a known working display. There is no chime as well. Not sure what else to check.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_SVS_L - 3.32V
PP3V3_SUS - 3.32
DM_RSMRST_L - 3.29V

Now when I trigger SMC_ONOFF_L I get 3.41 on PM_PWRBTN_L

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
So fan spins only if you trigger SMC_ONOFF_L signal?
Are you using original Apple  60/85W charger?

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Sorry I wrote that wrong. I edited the post. Fan spins anytime I plug MagSafe in. Still having issue of no video, no chime. Using a 45w original Apple charger.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
There are about 20 SPI Termination resistors; did you check them all?
Try new BIOS...

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Yes I tested each resistor and checked traces. All is good. What's involved in replacing the bios? Doesn't this need to be programmed first?

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Try new BIOS dump, of course; not another chip...

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Sorry for my ignorance. I've never done that before. Any direction you can give me I'd appreciate. (I'll start googling) haha

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Do I need a chip programmer for this? Searching didn't come up with much.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message:
Usual external programmer requires to remove the chip.
Medusa programmer can do the job onboard, through J6100 connector.

threads.title: 820-00164 No Power
threads.message: Problem resolved. Dumping the bios fixed the issue. Thanks again!
